msgSnippet: What is wrong with the concept of a defineable, repeatable, managed, optimized software development process?  Where would we be if Jules Verne had not dreamed

What is wrong with the concept of a defineable, repeatable, managed,
optimized software development
process?  Where would we be if Jules Verne had not dreamed of going to the
moon? Or Columbus
going to the New World?  Both events happened( regardless of what some small
fringe group say ).

The point I'm making is that if you do not have goals then you won't get the
benefits of reaching
even part of your goal.

Don't get me wrong. I have been on the butt end of an Enterprise CMM effort.
It's mucho annoying,
however, the underlying goal is still valid and drives toward better
software.

just my 2cents

Michael Holly
